Bio

Related

Stats

Historical

Biography

Drafted by the Chaos of the Premier Lacrosse League (3rd Round, 20th Overall)

Accolades and Awards

2024 Big Ten Distinguished Scholar

Four-time Academic All-Big Ten Selection (2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024)

2024 Season

2024 Honorable Mention All-American (USILA)

2024 First Team All-Big Ten

2024 Scholar All-American

USILA Team of the Week (Feb. 6, 2024)

2024 Preseason Honorable Mention All-American (USA Lacrosse Magazine and Inside Lacrosse)

2024 Big Ten Preseason Player to Watch

2024 Team Captain

Ahead of 2024 Season, Ranked #26 on Inside Lacrosse's Top 50 Men's Players Preseason List

Named to Tewaaraaton Award Watch List

2023 Season

2023 USILA Scholar All-American

2023 Honorable Mention All-American (USILA)

2023 Second Team All-Big Ten

2023 Werblin Award

Knight Cup Winner (Team Award for Inspiring Teammates on and off Field)

Alfred Sasser Trophy Winner (Team Assist Leader)

2023 Midseason All-American (Honorable Mention)

Named to 2023 Tewaaraton Award Watch List

2023 Team Captain

2023 Preseason All-American - Third Team (USA Lacrosse Magazine)

2023 Preseason All-American - Third Team (Inside Lacrosse)

#15 On Inside Lacrosse's Top 50 Men's Players Preseason List

2022 Season

2022 Third Team All-American (USILA)

2022 Honorable Mention All-American (Inside Lacrosse / Media)

2022 Honorable Mention All-American (USA Lacrosse Magazine)

2022 NCAA Tournament All-Tournament Team

2022 Big Ten All-Tournament Team

2022 Second Team All-Big Ten

2022 All-ECAC

2022 Werblin Award

2022 Frederick Fitch Trophy Winner (Team's Most Improved)

2022 Alfred Sasser Trophy Winner (Team Assist Leader)

2022 Big Ten Preseason Player to Watch

Named to 2022 Tewaaraton Award Watch List

Named to USILA Team of the Week (Mar. 29, 2022, April 27)

Big Ten Co-Offensive Player of the Week (Mar. 29, 2022)

USA Lacrosse Magazine National Player of the Week (May 17, 2022)

2022: Scored 50 Goals, tied for most in a single-season in RU program history with Tom Sweeney (1978)

2022: Posted 75 Points, second most in a single-season in RU program history

2020 Al Twitchell Award (Team's Most Valuable Freshman)

2024: Starting attackman in all 14 games ...led team with 45 points on team-high 25 assists ... scored 20 goals, second on the team ... had six multi-goal games and two hat tricks ... posted three games with three assists ... was sixth in Big Ten in assists per game (1.79) and eighth in points per game (3.21) ... also scooped 13 ground balls ... scored two goals and three assists, had one ground ball in win against Lehigh (Feb. 3) ... scored 3 goals and had 3 assists against Stony Brook (Feb. 10) ... had 2 assists against Army (Feb. 17) ... scored 2 goals with 2 assists and had 1 ground ball in win against Loyola (Feb. 24) ... Scored 2 goals and had 3 assists and 3 ground balls in win against Hofstra (Mar. 2) ... had 1 goal, 1 assist and 1 ground ball in win against Detroit (Mar. 5) ... had one goal, assist and ground ball against Princeton (Mar. 10) ... scored 2 goals against UMass (Mar. 16) ... had 2 assists and 2 ground balls against Johns Hopkins (Mar. 24) ... had a goal and two assists against Ohio State (March 30) ... scored three goals, one assist and two ground balls in win at No. 15/16 Michigan (April 7) ... scored one goal and had two ground balls against No. 4 Maryland (April 13) ... scored one goal and had two assists against No. 10 Penn State (April 19) ... had a goal and two assists at No. 10 Penn State in the Big Ten Tournament Quarterfinals (April 27)

2023: Starter at attack in all 14 games ... posted 25 goals and 17 assists for 42 points ... team's leader in points, tied for team-lead in assists, and second in goals ... also had 20 ground balls ... in the Big Ten, was eighth in points per game, ninth in assists per game and 12th in goals per game ... had six multi-goal games, including two games of five goals ... scored three goals with two ground balls in season-opening win over Marist (Feb. 4) ... had two goals and an assist in win over Stony Brook (Feb. 11) ... netted five goals in loss at Army (Feb. 18) ... added one goal in upset over No. 5/6 Loyola (Feb. 25) ... recorded second five-goal performance in three games with five scores against St. John's (Feb. 28) ... had six-point performance (three goals, three assists) in team's win over Utah (March 4) ... scored a goal in Rutgers' 14-13 overtime win over No. 13/14 Princeton in the 100th playing of the rivalry game (March 11) ... scored twice in less than a minute in team's victory over RV/RV UMass (March 18) ... recorded one goal in loss at No. 7 Johns Hopkins (April 1) ... added one goal and one assist in team's OT win over Michigan (April 7) ... dished out a career-high four assists and added one goal in loss to No. 4 Maryland (April 16) ... contributed one assist and three ground balls against No. 5 Penn State (April 21) ... dished out four assists against No. 7 Maryland in the Big Ten Tournament (April 29).

Summer 2022: Played for Team Canada at U-21 World Championships in Limerick, Ireland ... posted 17 goals and 11 assists for 28 points to lead team to Silver Medal ... named Most Outstanding Attacker of the Tournament and to the All-World Team

2022: Starter on attack in all 19 games ... led team with 50 goals, 25 assists and 75 points ... had 32 ground balls and four caused turnovers ... had 11 multi-goal games and nine hat tricks ... scored twice with an assist in season opening win over LIU (Feb. 5) ... had first career hat trick, with two assists, three ground balls and caused turnover over Marist (Feb. 9) ... posted five goals and two assists with a caused turnover in win at St. John's (Feb. 12) ... scored one goal and two assists in win over No. 10 Army (Feb. 19) … netted four goals in win at No. 19 Loyola (2/26) ... scored four goals, along with an assist and three ground balls in win at Stony Brook (Mar. 5) ... had a goal, two assists and three ground balls at No. 7 Princeton (March 11) ... had four goals and added three assists for seven point day in team's win over Lafayette (March 15) ... scored two goals and three assists along with a ground ball in win at Hofstra (Mar. 19) ... recorded four goals, three assists, five ground balls, and one caused turnover in win vs. No. 8/9 Ohio State (Mar. 27) ... had an assist to go with three ground balls and a caused turnover in win vs. Johns Hopkins (Apr. 3) ... recorded a goal and a ground ball at No.1 Maryland (Apr. 10) ... had an assist in win at Michigan (Apr. 16) ... netted five goals and recorded three ground balls in win vs. Penn State (Apr. 23) ... scored three goals and had one assist in win over No. 12 Ohio State in Big Ten Semifinals (May 5) ... scored a goal against No. 1 Maryland in Big Ten Championship game (May 7) ... posted eight goals, the most for any RU player since 2018 and second most ever in an NCAA Tournament game, in 19-9 home win over No. 14/17 Harvard in NCAA Tournament First Round (May 15) ... had a goal and an assist in NCAA Tournament Quarterfinals win over No. 3 Penn (May 21) to send team to Final Four ... scored a goal and had two assists with two ground balls in Final Four against No. 10 Cornell (May 28)

2021: Midfielder played in all 13 games, making two starts .. scored nine goals with five assists for 14 points, with four ground balls ... scored a goal and had one ground ball in home opener against PSU (Feb. 20)... notched 2 points with a goal and assist, plus 1 ground ball against Maryland (March 13)... 1 ground ball in win against Johns Hopkins (March 20)... scored goal in win against OSU (April 3)... posted goal in win against PSU (April 10)... had 2 goals in win against JHU (April 17)... notched 2 assists and 1 ground ball in regular season finale win against Michigan (April 25) ... scored against Johns Hopkins in Big Ten Semifinals (May 6) ... moved to starting lineup for NCAA Tournament win over Lehigh ... scored two goals and had an assist in NCAA Tournament Quarterfinals against top-seed UNC (May 22)

2020: Started three of team's six games, playing both midfield and attack ... had five goals and one assist for six points, fifth on the team ... scooped three ground balls ... in collegiate debut, scored two goals, collected a ground ball and caused a turnover in win over Quinnipiac (Feb. 1) .. scored one goal and had one assist in win at St. John's (2-8-20) ... made first career start at No. 11/12 Loyola (Feb. 22)... scored two goals against Stony Brook (Feb. 29).

Prior to Rutgers: Two-time US Lacrosse All-American … Adrenaline All-American … US Lacrosse Academic All-American … three-time First Team all-state … three-time First Team all-conference … four year varsity letterwinner who was a two-time captain … Led team to OHSLA 2019 State Championship and were 2017 TRL undefeated champions … National Honor Society member … four-year member of the Honor Roll … received West Linn HS Academic Excellence award … also played ice hockey, where he was three-time captain and invited to USA Hockey Pacific District camp … parents are Candace and Ross … has one older sister, Cailey, who played soccer at Westminster College … father played hockey at St. John’s University (Minnesota) while grandfather played football at Washington State
